page.title: 08Primary Schools:Winterbourne
page.content: Before 1981 there were two infant and two junior schools in Winterbourne. The number of children in the area had been falling for some years so St. Michael's C.of E. Juniors joined with St. Michael's Infant School and Elm Park Junior school combined with Greenfields Infant School. One of the Infant school buildings which was over 100 years old was used by the Ridings High School for a while but now stands empty. The more modern building became a teachers' centre. Although the new primary schools work very well many people think that it is a pity that a modern infant school building is no longer a school. Now if any parents in Winterbourne wanted to send their children to an infant rather than a primary school they would need to travel several kilometres to the nearest one.
